channel.title: NPR Topics: Economy
channel.description: NPR news on the U.S. and world economy, the World Bank, and Federal Reserve. Commentary on economic trends. Subscribe to NPR Economy podcasts and RSS feeds.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Supreme Court doubtful of Trump claim he can fire Fed governors by fiat
item.description: The Trump administration wants the authority to fire Lisa Cook, a Federal Reserve governor. Experts say that would undermine the independence of the central bank.
item.content:encoded:
The Trump administration wants the authority to fire Lisa Cook, a Federal Reserve governor. Experts say that would undermine the independence of the central bank.

(Image credit: Andrew Harnik)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: It's showdown time for the Fed's independence at the Supreme Court
item.description: At issue are President Trump's efforts to break with 112 years of law and precedent by firing Lisa Cook, a member of the Federal Reserve's governing board.
item.content:encoded:
At issue are President Trump's efforts to break with 112 years of law and precedent by firing Lisa Cook, a member of the Federal Reserve's governing board.

(Image credit: Saul Loeb)
item.dc:creator: Nina Totenberg

item.title: Are we in an AI bubble? Economists share the clues to look for
item.description: Are we in an AI bubble? Economists share the warning signs they watch for before the bubble bursts.
item.content:encoded: Are we in an AI bubble? Economists share the warning signs they watch for before the bubble bursts.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Guo

item.title: It took 75 governors to elect a woman. Abigail Spanberger is now at Virginia's helm
item.description: Spanberger, a former CIA officer and three-term congresswoman, is breaking long-held traditions on inauguration day. She says she wanted her swearing-in to showcase the state's modern vibrancy.
item.content:encoded:
Spanberger, a former CIA officer and three-term congresswoman, is breaking long-held traditions on inauguration day. She says she wanted her swearing-in to showcase the state's modern vibrancy.

(Image credit: Tyrone Turner)
item.dc:creator: Margaret Barthel

item.title: December board game update
item.description: This is a short update on the Planet Money Board Game project.
item.content:encoded: This is a short update on the Planet Money Board Game project.
item.dc:creator: Alex Goldmark

item.title: Canada agrees to cut tariff on Chinese EVs in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products
item.description: Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.
item.content:encoded:
Breaking with the United States, Canada has agreed to cut its 100% tariff on Chinese electric cars in return for lower tariffs on Canadian farm products, Prime Minister Mark Carney said Friday.

(Image credit: Sean Kilpatrick)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Are we in an AI bubble? Economists share the clues to look for
item.description: Are we in an AI bubble? Economists share the warning signs they watch for before the bubble bursts.
item.content:encoded: Are we in an AI bubble? Economists share the warning signs they watch for before the bubble bursts.
item.dc:creator: Jeff Guo

item.title: This teenager who wrote a research paper on how AI could impact teen jobs
item.description: A 17-year-old in California who got curious about the impact of AI on typical teen jobs. She embarked on an ambitious economic research project and shared her findings with us.
item.content:encoded: A 17-year-old in California who got curious about the impact of AI on typical teen jobs. She embarked on an ambitious economic research project and shared her findings with us.
item.dc:creator: Wailin Wong

item.title: NPR price-checks 114 items at Walmart
item.description: NPR price-checks 114 items at a Walmart in Georgia to see how costs have changed in a year.
item.content:encoded: NPR price-checks 114 items at a Walmart in Georgia to see how costs have changed in a year.
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh

item.title: How have prices changed in a year? NPR checked 114 items at Walmart
item.description: We found the effects of tariffs and extreme weather, relief (finally!) in the egg cooler, plus one case of shrinkflation.
item.content:encoded: We found the effects of tariffs and extreme weather, relief (finally!) in the egg cooler, plus one case of shrinkflation.
item.dc:creator: Alina Selyukh
